derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French and Old Northern French caroine, caroigne, Old French charoigne, based on Latin caro 'flesh'

entry.def: Carrion is the decaying flesh of dead animals.

example.ex: Crows circled overhead, looking for carrion.
example.tran: 乌鸦在头顶盘旋,寻觅着腐肉。

means.word_mean: 1. dead and rotting flesh; unfit for human food
2. the dead and rotting body of an animal

stems_affixes.word_buile: carn肉,肉欲+al……的→adj.肉体的;肉欲
carnivore[n.食肉动物]+ous……的→carnivorous食肉类的
in进入+carn肉,肉欲+ate表形容词→adj.具有肉体的,化身的
carc=carn肉,肉欲+ass表名词→n.[动物]尸体;残骸
carn肉,肉欲+age状态,总称→把人变成一堆肉→大屠杀
carn肉,肉欲+ation→这种花粉红色[肉色的]
carn肉,肉欲+ival节日→肉的节日→放荡肉欲的狂欢节日
carni=carn肉,肉欲+vor吃+e→吃肉的[动物]
carr=carn肉,肉欲→n.腐肉
re再+incarnate[v.体现,化身]→v.再具肉体,转生
